Package ui.menu.button

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.drawing.DrawableSection
      • ui.input.selection.DrawableSelectableSection
        • ui.menu.button.Button
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrintHandler, Section, SelectableSection, SelectionHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChangeViewButton, ExitButton, GameStartButton
    public abstract class Button
extends DrawableSelectableSection
implements SelectableSection
    Represents a selectable button.
    Represents a selectable section that can be drawn to the terminal window.
    Represents a section that can be drawn to the terminal window.

      • Button

        public Button​(java.lang.String text,
              Colour textColour,
              Colour bracketColour,
              BackgroundColour unfocusedColour,
              BackgroundColour focusedColour,
              boolean enabled)
        Constructor for Button.
        Parameters:
        text - The button text.
        textColour - The button text colour.
        bracketColour - The colour of the brackets that indicate this is a button.
        unfocusedColour - The background colour when unfocused.
        focusedColour - The background colour when focused.
        enabled - Boolean; true if button is enabled for selection.

    • Method Detail

      • focus

        public KeyHandler focus​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when this element is focused. If no handler is defined or section is not enabled call parent's focus method. If no parent is defined return current key handler. In this case set the background colour to the focused colour.
        Specified by:
        focus in interface SelectionHandler
        Overrides:
        focus in class DrawableSelectableSection
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (normally this element's movement selection handler).

      • unfocus

        protected void unfocus()
        Called whenever focus is lost (i.e. from moving to next selection). In this case set the background colour to the unfocused colour.
        Specified by:
        unfocus in class DrawableSelectableSection

      • getRow

        public void getRow​(ColouredStringBuilder builder,
                   int row,
                   int startCol,
                   int maxCols)
        Generates a single line of the section to be written to the terminal. In this case pass to the underlying section grid.
        Specified by:
        getRow in interface Section
        Parameters:
        builder - ColouredStringBuilder to handle ANSI colour coding in the most efficient manner.
        row - Which row of the section to generate.
        startCol - The column of the section to start at.
        maxCols - The max number of columns to draw.

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Getter for number of rows. In this case pass to the underlying section grid.
        Specified by:
        getRows in interface Section
        Returns:
        The height of the section in characters.

      • getColumns

        public int getColumns()
        Getter for number of columns. In this case pass to the underlying section grid.
        Specified by:
        getColumns in interface Section
        Returns:
        The width of the section in characters.

      • update

        public void update()
        Called before drawing the section. In this case pass to the underlying section grid.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Section
        Overrides:
        update in class DrawableSection
